The AA-12 actually has an advanced recoil mitigation system that makes it virtually non-existent. FPS Russias has a video of him dual wielding 2 and even firing one full auto with a single hand without bracing it.

John missed it, the AA12 in reality is open bolt; what's in the game is closed bolt.
Killing Floor 2 please

The forward mount scope rail on the M1A is clamped to the barrel and a special hand guard is used. You can use "dot" sights or a long eye relief scope. The mount is offered on the M1A Scout and Socom versions.

Curious that the detail crazy Gun expert made no mention of the trivial difference between an M1014 & a Super 90, as per Benelli themselves, what is shown in game, even with the shorter 5 round tube is the M1014, but if I recall correctly the vanilla stock in B4B is the single-piece polymer slab shoulder stock.

Thats it. That's the difference between the Super 90 & the M1014 "military" tactical shotgun, according to Benelli civilians shouldn't have the privilege of opting for the telescoping stock when they buy from them directly, that's reserved for current/former LEO/Service members.

The aftermarket heat shield replacement M1A scout rails are made to be mounted much more securely than the heat shield. Its actually a standard feature on the SOCOM 16 rifles. Just a little more info.
